robots.name: Spot
robots.summary: Nimble robot dog that can navigate terrain that wheeled robots cannot.
robots.description: Spot is a four-legged robot designed for industrial inspection and data collection. It's battery-powered and can operate for about 90 minutes on a charge. Spot can climb stairs, traverse rough terrain, and carry payloads up to 14 kg. It's equipped with cameras and sensors that allow it to perceive and navigate its environment autonomously.

videos.title: Spot in Action
videos.description: See how Spot moves and operates

robots.name: Atlas
robots.summary: Advanced humanoid robot designed to perform dynamic movements and tasks.
robots.description: Atlas is a humanoid robot developed by Boston Dynamics. It stands at about 1.5 meters tall and weighs around 80 kg. Atlas is known for its impressive mobility and agility, capable of performing backflips, parkour, and various dance routines. It uses hydraulic actuation and has 28 degrees of freedom. Atlas is designed to push the limits of whole-body mobility.

images.caption: Atlas can perform dynamic movements like jumps and flips

videos.title: Atlas Dance
videos.description: Atlas performing a choreographed dance routine

robots.name: ANYmal
robots.summary: Autonomous legged robot designed for industrial inspection tasks.
robots.description: ANYmal is a quadrupedal robot designed for autonomous operation in challenging environments. It can navigate stairs, steps, and gaps, making it ideal for inspection in industrial facilities. ANYmal is equipped with various sensors, including LiDAR and cameras, enabling it to create maps of its environment and operate autonomously. The robot is designed for industrial applications such as routine inspections in oil and gas plants or power stations.

images.caption: ANYmal is designed for industrial inspection tasks

videos.title: ANYmal in Action
videos.description: See ANYmal navigate challenging industrial environments
